unnormalised: Okay, so I've been hearing a LOT about Ayurveda lately. It's supposed to be this ancient Indian system of medicine that focuses on holistic healing, right? I'm intrigued, but also a little skeptical. Are these treatments actually effective, or is it just a bunch of hyped-up herbal remedies?
normalised: Okay, so I've been hearing a lot about Ayurveda lately. It's supposed to be this ancient Indian system of medicine that focuses on holistic healing, right? I'm intrigued, but also a little skeptical. Are these treatments actually effective, or is it just a bunch of hyped-up herbal remedies?

unnormalised: I've read about everything from Panchakarma (sounds intense!) to specific treatments for things like stress and digestion. My friend, Priya, swore by Shirodhara for her chronic headaches. She went to some place near Kerala for a 10-day retreat and said it was life-changing! Maybe I should give it a shot too? I do feel quite stressed with work.

unnormalised: Has anyone here actually tried Ayurvedic treatments? What was your experience like? Did it help with a specific condition? Were there any side effects? I’m particularly interested in treatments for joint pain, as my Nani (grandmother) has been suffering quite a bit lately. She's thinking of visiting the Kottakkal Arya Vaidya Sala sometime around 22/07/2024, but we’re not sure what to expect.

unnormalised: Also, any recommendations for reputable Ayurvedic practitioners or clinics in Delhi? I saw an ad for some place promising miracle cures in 3 days – seemed a little too good to be true! Looking for something authentic, you know? Maybe I could squeeze in a consultation on 01/08/2024 at 11:00 hrs.
